storyInfo: On a clear morning, the crisp clarion call of a pistol's muzzle reverberates across Volsinii through every radio.

attributes.content: Oh, you really came, Judge Lavinia!
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: You must be Segretario Rubio's daughter, yes?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Yeah! I thought my father was just joking around when he said you'd come babysit me!
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: My friends and I all adore you.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: Compared to people like my father, you're like, the only clean person in the government.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: Do you not get along well with your father?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Meh, so-so, I guess.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: I still like him as a person, because he always makes time for me and plays with me a lot.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: But you know, I think people like him, who only care about protecting themselves and not rocking the boat, really should have bigger goals in life.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: His old work friends who started out on the same level as him are way up there now.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: It took him this long to land a half-decent job, and he doesn't want to do anything more with it.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: His old work friends?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Yeah, one of them was Carracci, Ministro dei Lavori Pubblici, who just died not too long ago.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: It's a dangerous job.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: I know... But, I saw him on TV every day, and wise guys from all the big famiglie treated him really well.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: I dunno, I just think it doesn't make sense trying to be a politician if you can't make it to that level.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: That might be true.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: So, that's why I was really surprised when my father suddenly decided to become the new Ministro dei Lavori Pubblici.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: I'm not sure what finally made things click for him... But if he did it sooner, my mother probably wouldn't have divorced him.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: Divorced?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Yeah, she thought he was a good-for-nothing, so she left him a few years ago.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: But my mother has a temper, so I decided to stay with my father.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: Oh, by the way, you know how he got appointed ministro, right? Can you tell me more about it?
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: Sorry, I actually don't know anything...
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Aww, okay then.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: Anyway, you can sit anywhere you'd like.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: I'm not going anywhere today, but I do want to listen to my father's inaugural speech.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: (Segretario Rubio... keeps his room tidier than I would've expected.)
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: You're surprised too, huh? He probably seems like he'd be a total slob, but he keeps things pretty organized.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: Oh right, and he keeps a diary.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: Really?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Yeah, lemme think... Right, he keeps it over here.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: He only writes in it when he feels like it. It's not an every day thing.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: After years of jotting stuff down, he's still got all these blank pages.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: Does he not care if you snoop around his things?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: It's totally fine. He left it there because he doesn't mind people reading it.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: I've flipped through it a few times, but it's all boring stuff. I'd call it like, chronicles of a middle-aged man? Boring, it drags on and on.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: You can take a look if you want.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.text: March 5th
I ran into Carracci at a restaurant. We had a drink for the first time in a long while.
Reminiscing about old times, I couldn't help but to get teary-eyed.

attributes.content: Signor Rubio, this is where you'll be giving your speech.
attributes.name: Bellone Mafioso

attributes.content: Please leave me.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: But we've got orders to protect you.
attributes.name: Bellone Mafioso

attributes.content: Nobody could get in here, right?
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: Right. Okay.
attributes.name: Bellone Mafioso

attributes.content: Hmph. Power, huh.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: Now I'll barricade the door with the sofa... This is about as much as I can do.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: Okay...
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: Well, Carracci, I won't keep you waiting much longer. See you soon.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: How's it looking?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: The doctor says the strike just missed her heart by a few centimeters, so she didn't die instantly.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: But, she's still in really bad shape.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Where's Texas?
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Umm...
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: She's been in a stupor ever since she got back yesterday.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: She just sits there motionless. Won't even respond when I ask if she wants to eat.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Just give her some time. Croissant and I will guard the hospital, so please take care of her.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: No need to worry about me. You two look after yourselves.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: *sigh*... So bored.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Oh right, I heard there was supposed to be some speech today?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Maybe I'll give it a listen.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Buongiorno, my dear friends and citizens.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: I imagine most of you don't know much about me, and I can't blame you for that.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: After all, I came held very minor and unimportant role of Segretario di Sicurezza Alimentare before this.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: In fact, I believe that most of our dear citizens, apart from the late Ministro Carracci and the honorable Judge Lavinia, know very little about our government.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: I do not know Judge Lavinia very well, but I do have somewhat of a history with the late Ministro Carracci.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: I believe it would be appropriate to begin my speech with him, a figure everyone here should already be familiar with.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: Carracci and I both joined L'Autorità Garante della Concorrenza e del Mercato around the same time.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: He was strong and energetic, taking care of the fieldwork while I handled the paperwork behind the scenes.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: He became known within the system for his bold words and actions, and he even dared to challenge prominent famiglie.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: To be perfectly honest, it seemed like the guy was indomitable. He was almost taken out a few times by dissatisfied famiglie, but managed to weather the storm or push through the situation.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: But at the time, L'Autorità staff saw him as a pain, and nobody wanted to help him.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: So the job of reporting to him naturally fell to me, unpopular as I was.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: And let me tell you, that job took a whole lot out of me.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: But at the same time, it filled me with a sense of accomplishment.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: Though I could never be as direct and straightforward as him, I could do what I wanted to do through him vicariously, and that was a reward in itself.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: Throughout this process, the two of us became fairly well-acquainted.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: Leon, you were working with Carracci for the last two years, and I know you thought highly of him.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Does this account match with what you knew of him?
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: He certainly was energetic.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: He knew exactly how to deal with the famiglie, and that went beyond just being tactful. He knew how to help them under the table while also getting them to serve his interests.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: A lot of what he wanted to do would've been blocked by various famiglie, but in his hands, he always managed to get things done, step by step.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: I can tell you learned a lot from him.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: I just thought there were some similarities in the way I saw things and the way he operated.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: The days when problems can be solved with fighting and killing are over, padre mio.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: If the famiglie are going to survive, they have to adapt accordingly.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: You still don't understand, Leon.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: What do I not understand?
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: You've subconsciously lumped yourself in with Lavinia and Carracci.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: But don't ever forget, you are not one of them.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: If you really knew, you wouldn't be standing here.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Unfortunately, you're out of time.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Padre?
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Leon, if you get through this alive...
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: It's what it is.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Even though he was a thorn in the side of many famiglie, his talents were evident to all.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: And so, he rose through the ranks long before I did.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: In fact, I thought he wouldn't last long after his promotion.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: I used to think that, because he was never in a place where too many different interests overlapped, he wouldn't face any serious attempts on his life.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: If he kept behaving the same way he always did as he rose through the ranks, sooner or later, he was bound to step on toes that he could not afford to step on.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: I was wrong.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: I never knew my father could be such a talkative person.
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: What do you think, Judge Lavinia?
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: Judge Lavinia?
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: Lavinia seems completely oblivious to the calls of Rubio's daughter.
She is engrossed in the words of the diary in her hands.

attributes.text: May 3rd
Just resolved a small case, but it touched me deeply.
There's a problem that everyone is unaware of. Or, should I say, is turning a blind eye to.
Why, even in the age of Signora Sicilia, does Siracusa have two different sets of rules at once—one internal, and one external?
The brutality and greed of the famiglie have long been documented, but as brutal and greedy as they may be, they have chosen not to control things themselves.
There's a reason for this.
It's actually quite simple.
Population.
The institution of a famiglia is based on bloodline or personal identity.
And this inefficient organization means that the numbers in any given famiglia will never reach the order of magnitude required to manage even a nomadic city.
This means they must rely on a system established by the common citizenry, and they can only seize control of a behemoth such as Siracusa by manipulating this system behind the scenes.
Signora Sicilia was acutely aware of this fact, so after she rose to power, she drew an even more pronounced line between mafiosi and ordinary folk.

And by emphasizing her absolute might and control, she, over the past few decades, has gotten everyone in Siracusa to believe that in Siracusa, 'the existence of two orders, internal and external, is taken for granted.'
To the extent that everyone was forced to forget how the establishment of Siracusa's underground order was only made possible by the consistency of the outward-facing order.
This cannot be called anything other than a manifestation of political wisdom.

attributes.content: Rubio, you...
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: In fact, in our system, there is no shortage of people with the same fundamental intentions as Carracci.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: However, for various reasons, they finally chose to submit to these famiglie, even becoming their cronies.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: But Carracci was different. Not only did he not give in, he was always looking for ways to fight against them.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: And, his efforts paid off.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: He did not die as easily as I thought he would, and he even managed to climb higher.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: And when we met again at a banquet, he said something that I will never forget—
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: 'The famiglie these days are weak.'
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: This dude's pretty brave...
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Umm... Texas, there seems to be something happening outside. Lemme go check it out.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Exusiai.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Do you think... we could bring Giovanna back to Lungmen?
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Why not?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: She seems fun.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: But, it doesn't feel like that's what you think. Right?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Texas turns her eyes to the table by the window, upon which a necklace sits.
It was a symbol of trust from Signora Sicilia.
A gift that Giovanna left for her.
In her grandfather's eyes, the Columbian famiglie had soured.
They'd do anything for the sake of profit, getting involved in the lowest businesses, committing murders with no morals at all.
In her father's eyes, the Siracusan famiglie had decayed.
Passing up profit and opportunity, not fighting for their interests, limiting their progress for the sake of supposed morality. All of it was the pinnacle of stupidity.
In Texas's eyes, her father and grandfather were right and wrong.
If... If she is only angry about what happened to Giovanna,
then she could leave just like she did seven years ago, only this time bringing Giovanna with her.
However, when she got news of her grandfather's death, when she turned a blind eye to the carwash worker, when she turned her back on her father's orders to help, the only thought on her mind was—
There's no end to it all.
He showed me how to deal with the famiglie in a comically simple way—
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: He offered them goods they couldn't refuse. Benefits.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: It's not as if the famiglie couldn't take what he had.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: But what they always lacked was a great manager. They only knew how to plunder, but never actually learned how to govern.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: Relying on his outstanding abilities, he gradually became a celebrity to several prominent famiglie.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: And when they fought over who would fill the role of Ministro dei Lavori Pubblici, he became the candidate that everyone was happy with.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: Having said all this, I'm sure a lot of you will have questions—
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: You might think Carracci sounds like a guy who played both sides.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: But what I'd like to say is, in a country like Siracusa, a country rooted in evil, it has never been possible for a good person to exist.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: To put it mildly, we are all evil.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: Should he be saying stuff like that in an inaugural speech?
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.text: October 15th
I met with that judge, Lavinia.
From the way people talk about her, I imagined someone like Carracci, a righteous person who wasn't willing to throw away her integrity.
Meeting her only confirmed that.
There's no way she's unaware of the futility of what she's doing, in our current landscape.
There's no way she's unaware of the fact that should she ever cross any of the famiglia, her life would be in grave danger.
The irony of all this is, the rights of ordinary people that she strives to protect as a judge mean nothing in the eyes of the famiglie.
They mean so little to them that she has not been snuffed out on her path forward.
Talking to her was torture, because I had to hold back my admiration for her and treat her like I would anyone else.
Carracci once joked that my position made him feel at ease because even if he died, he knew I would be there to pick up the torch.
But... what if I also died?
It's not as if I haven't cultivated and won over a number of youths, but they've never had a leader with any real sway like Carracci.
And undoubtedly, Judge Lavinia would make an ideal successor.
Of course, I can't push my ideas on her.
But, I'm afraid I don't have much time left either.
There is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity in front of me. I don't have time to convey each and every one of my thoughts to her.
I do believe, however, that if my plan goes well, Judge Lavinia will at least be willing to look after my daughter.
Alas... Carracci, my old friend, let me put your death to good use.
If our souls can meet once more, I'll have to apologize to you again.
—But, a noble soul like yours probably won't end up in the same place as mine, haha.

attributes.content: Ugh, I knew we should've relocated as soon as we could.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: But we're just gonna have to work with this, considering everything that happened yesterday.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Gah, that Sankta's a pain in the ass.
attributes.name: Mafioso

attributes.content: It's just one woman! Surround her!
attributes.name: Mafioso

attributes.content: My trusty partner here is trying to relax, so mind keeping it down?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Ugh, you guys sure love raising hell, don't you?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Oh, if anyone else was here, they'd probably be like, 'But Exusiai, you also love raising hell too!'
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: It sure sucks having to do this alone.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: What's this? Someone need a helping hand?
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: I've been wondering, do you, like... have way too much time on your hands?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: I'm just like you. We're all waiting for an answer.
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: What do you mean by that?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Does it make a big difference to you whether or not Texas goes back to Lungmen?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Absolutely.
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: And as of right now, I want her to go back.
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: Hmm... Does that mean you're on our side?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Sure does.
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: Great. Can't party alone.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Sorry, sorry. I shouldn't have said all that depressing stuff.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: However, it should be clear to everyone by now that I'm not here to give an inaugural speech.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: I came here to speak from my heart.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: Carracci, as bold as his vision was, never mentioned anything to me about his outlook regarding the new city.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: The reason for that is, when he took up his position, he was already prepared to die.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: We've all borne witness to what he did over the past two years.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: And just when I thought he might make it long enough to see the birth of the new city, he suddenly died a few days ago.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: As for me, that was the last straw.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: So, I cozied up to Famiglia Bellone, recommended myself to them, and obtained this position.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: In that process, I discovered a shocking conspiracy the Bellone and Saluzzo famiglie have been brewing—
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: From the very beginning, they plotted to plunge this city into chaos and seize the newly-built nomadic city.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: Then, they will seek to leverage it against Signora Sicilia.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: Don Alberto, this—
attributes.name: Loyal Mafioso

attributes.content: Any news from Bernardo yet?
attributes.name: Alberto

attributes.content: No, Don Alberto.
attributes.name: Loyal Mafioso

attributes.content: What's the meaning of this, Bernardo?
attributes.name: Alberto

attributes.content: Danbrown.
attributes.name: Alberto

attributes.content: Danbrown!
attributes.name: Alberto

attributes.content: ...I'm here.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: You're near Rubio's location, right?
attributes.name: Alberto

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: Whack that lunatic.
attributes.name: Alberto

attributes.content: Yes, Don Alberto.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: Alright... I guess I can't keep you out, if you really want to come in.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: You're an idiot.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: What's the point of all this?
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: The way you're dressed... Are you an ordinary worker?
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: I work at a carwash. It's called 'Auto Lavaggio Danbrown.'
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: Oh, that rings a bell.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: So, you must be Danbrown then?
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: That's me.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: Do you have any particular concerns about your job?
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: Siracusa's gotten soggy and stale. I've had nothing to do, so I found some work for myself.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: That's a shame. You should've looked a little harder.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: You arrogant wise guys think you can lord over us forever.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: You think your only enemies are each other, you never take any of us seriously.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: But, the times are changing. Nothing stays the same forever.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: No matter how nice your words might sound, they're just words.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: Can words overthrow the famiglie, or Signora Sicilia?
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: No, but I've taken this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity and said what I needed to say.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: As for who'll win between the Bellones and Signora Sicilia, I don't know, or care.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: All I know is—this new era has no room for the likes of you.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: If the next chapter of Siracusan history is about to be written, the heroes of that story won't be the famiglie.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: We may have no power. We may indeed be weak.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: But we know that civilization rose to overcome this savagery.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: We pursue a form of equality, an order not rooted in violence.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: Violence is in our nature.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: Really now? Why, then, are all the famiglie moving in the same direction?
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: Why are they chasing money and power instead of violence and conflict?
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: Is killing me today just a cathartic release of this violence?
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: Or is it because... I got in the way of the people behind you taking power?
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: See, you already know the answer.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: And, if you don't mind, I'd like to be the one to finish myself off.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: Do you know what this is?
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: A gun?
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: That's right. I purchased it from Blacksteel a few years ago, through my connections.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: It's hard to use, and it's not very useful against a pack of wise guys lunging at you.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: All it can do is offer a little protection to one as weak as myself.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: By the looks of things, I already figured out who I should be pointing it at years ago.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: Rubio slowly raises the gun's muzzle to his temple.
Oh right, Danbrown.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.content: I hope that one day, you can just be a regular carwash worker here in Siracusa. One who never has to hold a weapon, ever again.
attributes.name: Rubio

attributes.text: October 19th
How I yearn to unload everything on my chest in a speech.
But, I cannot.
I have to convince them that I decided to take revenge on the famiglie because of Carracci's death.
Plus, there are some words that cannot be spoken yet.
I'm not here to usher in a new era. I'm not arrogant enough to think that.
I don't even know how many hearts my words will be able to reach.
But, I believe that as long as this country still has people like me, Carracci, and Lavinia...
Then there is still hope for Siracusa.
So, I will write what I wanted to say here:
Having said so much about Carracci, the reality is, as you may realize, I'm not here to talk about Carracci.
I'm here to talk about myself. And all of us, my dear citizens.
We live in a cage called the famiglie.
They may not always directly affect our lives, but they are always a part of it.
Every ordinary person in Siracusa, over the course of their lives, will come to gain their own understanding of the famiglie through various ways.
And eventually, they get used to it.
However, I hope you can take a good look at the people around you, and look back at your own life.
There is one thing we all should understand—
We are human beings. Our lives are very much real. We are not livestock in a pen.
And above all, we are powerful.
Our power comes from the very lives we have created.
The lives the mafiosi relish in were also created by our hands.
This is the country we've built, brick by brick.

attributes.content: Judge Lavinia, am I dreaming? Why is my father... talking with a hitman like that?
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: No, father! He's in danger!
attributes.name: Rubio's Daughter

attributes.content: Lavinia feels tears welling up in her eyes.
But she does not have time to wipe them, because she already has a premonition in her heart.
She moves to Rubio's daughter and gently covers her ears.
The inhabitants of Volsinii will never forget this day.
On a clear morning, the crisp clarion call of a pistol's muzzle reverberates across Volsinii through every radio.
Former Volsinii Segretario di Sicurezza Alimentare Rubio died during his inaugural speech, taking over as Ministro dei Lavori Pubblici.
The chaos that ensued, though it would be subdued before half a day's time, in fact became the first step toward a new era for Siracusa.
